snippet: Unless Congress acts soon, a law that protects borrowers from unexpectedly large tax bills will expire.
abstract: Editorial warns that debt-relief law enacted in 2007, which excludes from taxation much forgiven debt on a primary home, will expire at end of this year unless Congress acts soon; says without extension of law, homeowners will be left without the legal protection they need to manage their overwhelming mortgage debt; urges Congress to renew and reinforce law.
lead_paragraph: Unless Congress acts soon, a law that protects borrowers from unexpectedly large tax bills will expire.
